intro: Papaver rumelicum, commonly known as the meadow poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, bright orange to red flowers with a prominent black center, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It grows up to 30–60 cm tall and prefers well-drained soils in open habitats. Papaver rumelicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and meadows.
